choices.B: The underlying query of the view is resource-intensive.
choices.C: The underlying query of the view is run on large data sets.
choices.A: The underlying query of the view takes a lot of time to run.

discussion.content: My bad, the question is about when standard view is preferable vs MATERIALZIED VIEW. Answer is D.

Selected Answer: B
Exact definition of the Materialized views is that the underlying query is not changing often. Exact definition says that the Materialized views are necessary when it is about query compute resource intensive and complex. The answer is B

questions.question_text: When would creating and using a standard view be preferable to using a materialized view?
When using a direct share, what privileges does a role need to control access to the objects that are in a share that is using database roles? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Query Time Travel data on the database.
choices.A: Create a clone of the database.
choices.D: Create streams on objects in the database.
choices.E: Query data from the objects in the database.
choices.B: Edit the comments for the database.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Changing my answer to DE https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-share-consumers this documentation page explicitly says that you cannot query time travel and that you can create streams on shared databases objects

Selected Answer: E
Answer D and E.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-share-consumers#creating-streams-on-shared-views-or-tables

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-share-consumers#general-limitations-for-imported-databases

Selected Answer: C
C and E seems correct (website won't let me choose two answers)

comments.content: I change my mind to D and E

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I agree. C and E. For sure it cannot be stream (D) because stream involves Insert, Delete Update, which are DML and the consumer of share cannot change the shared objects.

Selected Answer: C
Answer is Cand E 
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-share-consumers

questions.question_text: What actions can be performed by consumers of shared databases? (Choose two.)

A Snowflake user is actively logged into Snowflake when a user-level network policy is assigned to that user.

What will Snowflake do if the user's IP address does not match the user-level network policy rules?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I checked the link from c561a14.

Selected Answer: C
Per Snowflake's documentation - In addition, when a user-level network policy is associated with the user and the user is already logged into Snowflake, if the userâ€™s network location does not match the user-level network policy rules, Snowflake prevents the user from executing further queries. - https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/network-policies

choices.D: Allow the user to continue until the session or login token expires.
choices.C: Prevent the user from executing additional queries.

questions.question_text: True or False: A Virtual Warehouse can be resized while suspended.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It is False as you cannot resize a virtual warehouse while it is suspended, you need to have a active warehouse to provide the compute clusters

Selected Answer: A
Ans is true

Selected Answer: A
Yes, it can be resized both when it is suspended or active (even when queries are running).
